revised_title: Standardizing Platinum Resistance Thermometers Using the Boiling Point of Sulphur
tldr: The authors describe a method for standardizing platinum resistance thermometers using the boiling point of sulphur. They determine the boiling point of sulphur and provide a detailed description of the apparatus and method used. The results show that the method is accurate and can be used to standardize thermometers for temperature measurements between 0°C and 100°C.
